content.description: Climb up the orange and black flake to a decent stance about 6-7 ft off the ground. There is a finger size crack in back of the flake. Plug in a few small cams. Fire through the delicate layback and clip the first bolt from a solid jug. Move left from the first bolt clipping two more bolts from positive but pumpy holds. After the bulge, run it out through easy terrain to the anchors.
content.protection: 3 bolts plus finger size cams. We took C4s from .3 to .75. There is a bolted anchor up top.
content.location: Left of Midday Lightening. The route begins on a nice orange and black flake.

content.description: Steady climbing through first two bolts getting easier up high. Goes straight up and meanders to the right and up to anchors.
content.protection: Two bolts with some small placements and anchors at the top.
content.location: Down hill left of Pepper and Salt near center of the wall.

content.description: From the guide book: Climb the knobby face past low and high cruxes to a set of anchors at mid-height.
content.location: Right of the gaping off-width that lies right of Dirty Girl.

content.description: Start on a jug with no feet and pull up into a stance. Place some gear and work wide stems and undercling to a nice crack. Continue stemming outward working jams to the lip. Commit to a short hand crack above you and bust through to a wide slot. Continue through varied climbing on good gear and holds to the anchor.
content.protection: SR to #4. Small cams useful (C3's/Totem). Optional #5. Runners. 2 Bolt Anchor.
content.location: This route is on the far east side of the cliff line (climber's right). Just left of Anthrax (5.9) and 1-2 minutes right of Levitation (11d).

content.description: Climb the 5.7 dihedral "Frisbie Golf", climb past it's anchors through the roofs.
content.protection: Protection for "Frisbie Golf", plus 3 bolts through the roofs. A #2 horizontal protects a runout.

content.description: A bolted left angling blunt arête starting off a detached block. Very fun route and a good warm-up.
content.location: Located right where the trail meets the cliff.

content.description: Obvious pillar/buttress further down the cliff line, climb the left side through a crux or two with solid pro to the anchors
content.location: Step across boulder to base of climb

content.description: Climb up a flared crack for a short distance before wandering up the top face. This is the most direct line to the anchors on this wall with 4 other routes merge into this and share anchors.
content.location: Located ~20 feet left of Pepper and Salt, starting in a flared crack.

content.description: Offwidth left facing corner with lots of face holds requiring no offwidth technique. Kind of a fun little route. Would be awesome if the crack went for a 100 ft. or more.
content.protection: Bring the big cams( #5 and #6 camalots )plus a few small cams for the horizontals. Bolted anchors are up on the left about 3/4 up the wall.
content.location: This route is up the hill on the left from Midday Lightning in the left facing corner and to the right of the bolted route Pepper and Salt.

content.description: A classic left facing corner crack with a short offwidth section leading up to a roof system. A leftward underclinging traverse leads to a foot rail then up another short corner to another roof traverse. Move easily to the anchors on the left. This is the must do route at Haw Creek.
content.protection: double up on #1 to # 3 camalots. Bring a #4 (in the crux traverse) and a #5 (for the OW ) and a few small cams for the start and the finish.
content.location: Located to the right of where the trail meets the rock. Can't miss it. Very obvious clean corner capped by a tiered roof.

content.description: Stickclip the first bolt and begin the rightward traversing "dreamcatcher" feature for 4 bolts.Gain a decent edge/finger bucket and load up for a powerful boulder problem on thin but positive edges. Throw to the jug ledge and cruise low end 5.11 pulls on awesome railed features and beautiful red stone to the chains.
content.location: Located just right of "For Whom The Bell Tolls"

content.description: Work your way up a the thin flake that starts nearly straight and then begins to pull left.  Easy warmup and nice route for the beginning trad climber.
content.protection: High first placement (15'), but bomber hands and feet make it feel super solid. Small cams #000 up to #2.  Currently shares anchors with Sangre Americana, although probably better served by having its own.
content.location: Just left of the gaping off-width crack between Land of the Free (5.7, to its left) and Pepper and Salt (5.9, to its right).

content.description: This is an easy jug-lined crack. Rock quality was decent. The route would probably be 5.7, except its a little steep down low. A fun warm up.
content.protection: Rack to #4 camelot. Two bolt anchor.
content.location: From Pepper and Salt, move left about 50 ft around a corner. This is NOT the left leaning crack in the back of the dihedral. It's just before that.

content.description: Bolted arête to the left of the classic dihedral For Whom the Bell Tolls. Pull over a low roof (crux) and follow the arête with great holds on both sides to a set of bolted anchors.
content.protection: 5 bolts and bring either a #1 or a .75 camalot for the run-out between the last bolt and the anchors.
content.location: The bolted arête to the left of For Whom the Bell Tolls corner. Just to the right of where the trail meets the cliff.

content.description: This is the place that most people go to when visiting Haw Creek.  A great range of 5.7-5.9 Trad and Sport routes from 5.9-5.12.
